page.title: 04SNAILS
page.content: Aldingham is full of snails! We saw lots of snails in the bushes, hedgerows and rough patches of brambles. Most of them were small, about the size of a garden pea. We weren't sure whether they were recently hatched from their eggs or a small variety. Tracy got lots of them. Laura got a match box full of them. When snails move they make a slimy trail behind them. They are a bit like slugs but snails have a shell which acts like a home. The shell is shaped like a spiral. Snails live on leaves, well all of them were on the leaves at Aldingham. Some were on top of the leaves and some were underneath. The leaves had holes in them because the snails had eaten them. They like to eat green or decaying leaves.
